name: Axis deer antler bracelet or anklet
description:
Here on Molokai we are lucky to be surrounded by hundreds of Axis deer who shed their antler every year for us to find. My husband slices them for me and I sand them to bring out their natural beauty. They are strung on hand braided sinew which is long enough to tie into a bracelet or anklet (for man or woman). The overall measurement is 17 inches. Once fit to your liking the ends can be cut and singed. The antler slice measures about 1 inch and is 1/4 inch thick.

Made with aloha on the island of Molokai

name: Laiki lenalena earrings
description:
These precious gem quality shells were painstakingly collected from the shores of the island of Molokai. They are the same species that have made the island of Ni'ihau so famous.

These are laiki lenalena which are about 1/4 inch each strung together with a pretty white puka shell. The shells measure about 1 inch from puka top to laiki bottom. They are strung on sterling silver ear wires. They are dainty and make a wonderful sound when you move your head.

Custom orders are always welcome. Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Puka shell bracelet
description:
Natural puka shells which have been gathered from the secluded beaches of the island of Molokai. The only puka which has been altered in any way is the one that makes the clasp. I enlarged the hole just a bit to make room for the cowry lip to fit through. The rest have been shaped by ke Akua (God) and the sea. I have joined the puka together with hand braided sinew. This bracelet is made to last. You can wear it in the ocean, shower and everywhere else. It is very comfortable to wear. I guarantee the workmanship...if you have any problems with it just mail it back to me and I will restring it. 

Each puka measures about 1/2 inch. The total measurement from puka to puka is 7 1/4 inches. If you want to know how this would fit you, you can take a string 7 1/4 inches long and hold the ends together around your wrist and that would be accurate. 

Made with Aloha on the island of Molokai.

My shipping preference is USPS Priority. I will gladly ship worldwide for actual shipping cost. Please email me with your zip code for a quote.

name: Tiny horn shell bracelet and earring set
description:
Many hours have been spent gathering, sorting, piercing and sewing the tiny shells. The shells measure between 1/4 inch and 3/8 inch each. You are witnessing the natural beauty of these shells as nothing has been used to enhance them. They have been gathered from the secluded beaches of Molokai.
 
The bracelet measures 7 1/2 inches from end to end and has a shell clasp. It is strung on 30 lb beading string. I have a 7 inch wrist and it hangs loosly without falling off. The earrings measure one inch from puka to bottom and hang on sterling silver ear wires.
 
Custom orders are always available. Made with Aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Kahelelani Momi and Laiki shell lei
description:
These precious gem quality shells were painstakingly collected from the shores of the island of Molokai. They are the same species that have made the island of Ni'ihau so famous. My work has been mistaken for Ni'ihau originals because I learned my traditional sewing techniques from a Ni'ihau Aunty. 

This is a five strand 20" lei made from Niihau variety shells that have been gathered from the island of Molokai. The actual lei that is in the photos has been sold, however, another one similar is in process. The shells are gathered and sorted and it will take me about 3 weeks to complete. It is kipona (mixed) style. There is a strand of kipona kahelelani sewn pikake style, and single strands of momi, laiki ke'o ke'o, laiki lenalena and laiki a pu'u pu'u. The traditional closure is poleholeho 'apu'upu'u (bumpy cowry) and puka. It can be worn straight or twisted

This is an heirloom quality piece...Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.

Custom orders are always welcome.

name: Hand knotted black lava mala with tassel
description:
I started making mala prayer beads at the request of the local gallery where I display my work. The response has been so amazing that I thought that I would add them to my store too. You will love the texture and feel of these lovely lava beads. 

There are 108 8mm lava beads on waxed cotton cording which is hand knotted between each bead for added strength. The guru bead is 18mm and the tassel measures 3 inches. The overall piece measures 24 inches.

Well used mala are known to break. Because of the inherent nature of the lava beads this may happen faster than you are used to. I will gladly re-string your mala at any time, just mail it to me along with return postage. 

Custom orders are always welcome. Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Black Francolin feather earrings
description:
The black francolin is a member of the pheasant family also known as a black partridge. He is abundant on our island and one of my favorite birds. His loud calls can be heard early in the morning and in the evening. They are frequent visitors here on our ranch as they enjoy cleaning up the extra chicken feed that I "accidentally" spill for them =) These feathers are gathered.

I have fashioned these earrings out of three feathers which fit snugly in a coconut shell bead. These feathers are completely natural in form. I love the little white heart at the end of the middle feather. The colors are wonderful...black, white, camel and fluffy grey down. They measure approximately 3 1/2 inches.

I will be listing more of these as I make them. Each pair will be photographed as each pair will be different. Custom orders are always welcome.

name: Newborn photo prop little mermaid costume
description:
As my very talented daughter embarks on her career as a photographer, I am enjoying helping her with her props. I get the added benifit of using her photos on my listings =) Thank you MadelineAnna.

For the little mermaid in your life, I created this crocheted mermaid tail with a cute little starfish top and headband. This is a newborn size. The tail measures 18 inches, headband measures 14 inches and is slightly stretchy. The yarn is acrylic and very soft for baby. 

Other sizes can be special ordered. In most cases I can have them in the mail a couple of days from when I receive your order.

name: Lava rosary with ornate pewter crucifix
description:
I fell in love with the texture of these lava beads. They are lightly polished as to be comfortable in your hands but still raw enough to remind you that they are lava.

There are 5 decades of hand knotted lava beads strung on waxed cotton cord with an ornate pewter crucifix. Laying flat it measures just over 21 inches. The opening is about 27 inches. The Our Father beads are 12 mm and the Hail Mary beads are 10 mm. The pewter crucifix measures 1 3/4 inches. 


Custom orders are always welcome. Made with Aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Saint Damien of Molokai sterling silver wrapped shell rosary
description:
Saint Damien of Molokai was canonized on October 11 2009. He served the people of Kalaupapa for 16 years before he died at the age of 49. 
He is considered the patron of outcasts, including those with Hansen's disease and HIV/AIDS, and the State of Hawaii.

This unique rosary is made from shells gathered from the Island of Molokai. Each tiny shell is hand wrapped with sterling silver wire and there is a lovely Saint Damien center and crucifix also made of sterling silver.
The Hail Mary shells are laiki ke'oke'o and the Our Father shells are momi lenalena waha 'ele'ele. This variety of shell is known worldwide as Ni'ihau shells as they are commonly found on that island. We also have them here on Molokai. 

These shells are very tiny, most of them less than 1/4 inch. If you lay the rosary out it measures 24 inches.

name: Pupu au kahelelani shell earrings
description:
These precious gem quality shells were painstakingly collected from the shores of the island of Molokai. They are the same species that have made the island of Ni'ihau so famous.

The speckled shells are pupu au (veil drupe shells) which are sewn with kahelelani kipona (mixed pink kahelelani) and laiki ke'oke'o (white rice shells) topped with a puka. The shells measure 1 3/4 inches and they are hung on sterling silver 1/2 inch ear wires. 

Many hours have been spent gathering, sorting, piercing and sewing the tiny shells. Kahelelani measure one eighth of an inch. You are witnessing the natural beauty of these shells as nothing has been used to enhance them. The beautiful pink color and shiny luster is created by ke Akua (God) together with the sea.

Custom orders are always welcome. Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Puka and kahelelani shell earrings
description:
These precious gem quality shells were painstakingly collected from the shores of the island of Molokai. They are the same species that have made the island of Ni'ihau so famous. My work has been mistaken for Ni'ihau originals because I learned my traditional sewing techniques from a Ni'ihau Aunty. 

Kulapepeiao kipona kahelelani, mixed kahelelani sewn pikake style topped with a puka and hung on sterling silver ear wires. From puka to bottom measures one inch.

Many hours have been spent gathering, sorting, piercing and sewing the tiny shells. Kahelelani measure one eighth of an inch. You are witnessing the natural beauty of these shells as nothing has been used to enhance them. The beautiful pink color and shiny luster is created by ke Akua (God) together with the sea. 

Custom orders are always welcome. Each pair is slightly different. Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Hand knotted red lava hand mala with drupe shell
description:
I started making mala prayer beads at the request of the local gallery where I display my work. The response has been so amazing that I thought that I would add them to my store too. 
You will love the texture and feel of these lovely lava beads. They are hand knotted with a drupe shell guru. 

There are 27 10mm beads. The shell measures 3/4 inch. The piece measures 6 1/2 inches flat and fits nicely in my small crochet pouch which can be purchased separately. 

Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Hand knotted black lava mala with chartreuse skull guru
description:
I started making mala prayer beads at the request of the local gallery where I display my work. The response has been so amazing that I thought that I would add them to my store too. You will love the texture and feel of these lovely lava beads. They are hand knotted with a chartreuse skull guru and finished with a handmade tassel. 

There are 108 8mm beads. The piece measures 23 inches flat. 

Custom orders are always welcome. Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Saint Damien of Molokai necklace
description:
Saint Damien of Molokai was canonized on October 11 2009. He served the people of Kalaupapa for 16 years before he died at the age of 49. 
He is considered the patron of outcasts, including those with Hansen's disease and HIV/AIDS, and the State of Hawaii.

This Saint Damien image is covered with a glass dome pendant and hangs on a lovely antique brass chain. The chain measures 18 inches.

Made with Aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Hand knotted black lava anklet with Krobo glass bead
description:
Krobo beads are made from recycled glass by the Krobo tribe in Ghana. Discarded bottles are ground into a powder and placed into a mould. A cassava stick is placed in the middle of each bead which burns out during firing in traditional kilns. Each bead is unique. My beads are acquired from a fair trade dealer.

This Krobo bead is hand knotted with 8 mm black lava beads. The anklet measures 10 inches and includes a pewter lobster clasp.

If you need a different size, just ask and I will make one for you. Custom orders are always welcome. Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Long black francolin feather earrings
description:
The black frankolin is a member of the pheasant family also known as a black partridge. He is abundant on our island and one of my favorite birds. His loud calls can be heard early in the morning and in the evening. They are frequent visitors here on our ranch as they enjoy cleaning up the extra chicken feed that I "accidentally" spill for them =) These feathers are gathered and sterilized.

I have fashioned these earrings out of three feathers which fit snugly in a coconut shell bead and hang from antique brass chain and earwires. These feathers are completely natural in form. The colors are wonderful...black, white, camel and fluffy grey down. They measure approximately 5 1/2 inches.

I will be listing more of these as I make them. Each pair will be photographed as each pair will be different. Custom orders are always welcome.

name: Lava and kahelelani shell earrings
description:
These precious gem quality shells were painstakingly collected from the shores of the island of Molokai. They are the same species that have made the island of Ni'ihau so famous. My work has been mistaken for Ni'ihau originals because I learned my traditional sewing techniques from a Ni'ihau Aunty. 

Kulapepeiao kipona kahelelani, mixed kahelelani sewn pikake style topped with a globe of lava and hung on sterling silver ear wires. From lava to bottom measures one and three eighths inch. 

Many hours have been spent gathering, sorting, piercing and sewing the tiny shells. Kahelelani measure one eighth of an inch. You are witnessing the natural beauty of these shells as nothing has been used to enhance them. The beautiful pink color and shiny luster is created by ke Akua (God) together with the sea.

Custom orders are always welcome. I have additional pairs like these on display at a local gallery, let me know if you need more. Each pair is slightly different. Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Hand knotted black lava mala with kukui nut guru
description:
I started making mala prayer beads at the request of the local gallery where I display my work. The response has been so amazing that I thought that I would add them to my store too. 

108 black lava beads are hand knotted and joined by a beach tumbled kukui nut guru bead. To the ancient Hawaiians kukui nuts were used for light, navigation, medicine, divination, and many other purposes. The kukui represents spirit revealing itself, enlightenment. The strand is tied off with puka shells which have been gathered from the secluded beaches of our island. This piece has a beautiful antiqued look and can also be worn as an adornment. 

There are 108 8mm beads. The piece measures 21 inches to the bottom of the kukui.

Custom orders are always welcome. Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Pipipi shell bracelet
description:
This very traditional Hawaiian bracelet is made from Pipipi shells gathered from the beaches of the Island of Molokai. There is a bracelet similar to this one in the Bishop Museum...of course I have used modern 30 pound strength beading string. The shells are carefully drilled and graduated. It makes a lovely sound when you wear it.

The shells measure from 5mm to 8mm, the overall measurement of the bracelet is 7 1/2 inches.

Custom orders are always welcome...made with Aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Lava chaplet or bracelet with pewter crucifix
description:
You will love the texture of these lava beads. They are lightly polished as to be comfortable in your hands but still raw enough to remind you that they are lava. This is a single decade chaplet made with 8 mm hand knotted lava beads and a lovely pewter crucifix. If worn as a bracelet it measures 7 1/2 inches. When flat it measures 8 1/2 inches. 

Custom orders are always welcome. Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Long puka and kahelelani earrings
description:
These precious gem quality shells were painstakingly collected from the shores of the island of Molokai. They are the same species that have made the island of Ni'ihau so famous. My work has been mistaken for Ni'ihau originals because I learned my traditional sewing techniques from a Ni'ihau Aunty. 

Kulapepeiao kipona kahelelani, mixed kahelelani sewn pikake style topped with a puka and hung on sterling silver ear wires. From puka to bottom measures 1 1/2 inch. 

Many hours have been spent gathering, sorting, piercing and sewing the tiny shells. Kahelelani measure one eighth of an inch. You are witnessing the natural beauty of these shells as nothing has been used to enhance them. The beautiful pink color and shiny luster is created by ke Akua (God) together with the sea.

Custom orders are always welcome. Each pair is slightly different. Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Hand knotted black lava bracelet with Krobo glass bead
description:
Krobo beads are made from recycled glass by the Krobo tribe in Ghana. Discarded bottles are ground into a powder and placed into a mould. A cassava stick is placed in the middle of each bead which burns out during firing in traditional kilns. Each bead is unique. My beads are acquired from a fair trade dealer.

This Krobo bead is hand knotted with 8 mm black lava beads. The bracelet is adjustable from 7 to 9 inches. 

Custom orders are always welcome. Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.

name: Puka kahelelani shell and lava earrings
description:
These precious gem quality shells were painstakingly collected from the shores of the island of Molokai. They are the same species that have made the island of Ni'ihau so famous. My work has been mistaken for Ni'ihau originals because I learned my traditional sewing techniques from a Ni'ihau Aunty. 

Kulapepeiao kipona kahelelani, mixed kahelelani sewn pikake style together with a globe of lava, topped with a puka and hung on sterling silver ear wires. The shells measure one and three eighths inch. 

Many hours have been spent gathering, sorting, piercing and sewing the tiny shells. Kahelelani measure one eighth of an inch. You are witnessing the natural beauty of these shells as nothing has been used to enhance them. The beautiful pink color and shiny luster is created by ke Akua (God) together with the sea.

Custom orders are always welcome. I have additional pairs like these on display at a local gallery, let me know if you need more. Each pair is slightly different. Made with aloha on the island of Molokai.
